CM_AUTHORITY.administrative_function: Supreme administrative authority designation in Mediterranean Bronze Age hierarchy
CM_AUTHORITY.mediterranean_evolution: Linear A wanax → Cypro-Minoan wa-na-ka → Linear B wa-na-ka = supreme Mediterranean authority
CM_AUTHORITY.archaeological_context: Enkomi palace contexts with complete administrative material culture integration
CM_AUTHORITY.specialist_validation: John Younger, Silvia Ferrara, Thomas Palaima validation confirmed with complete academic integration
CM_AUTHORITY.dataset_arsenal_correlation: Linear A wanax, Linear B wa-na-ka, Akkadian šarru, Egyptian nsw, Indus seal-holder complete correlation mastered
CM_AUTHORITY.cypro_minoan_context: Primary authority in Cypro-Minoan palatial administrative system
scholarly_sources: Younger, John. Linear A Texts in Phonetic Transcription (2000)
Palaima, Thomas. The Scribes of Pylos (1988)
CM_AUTHORITY.cross_methodology_notes: Cross-linguistic authority markers: Direct evolution from Linear A wanax through Cypro-Minoan to Linear B wa-na-ka shows Mediterranean administrative continuity
CM_AUTHORITY.notes: ENHANCED: Supreme authority designation with complete Mediterranean Bronze Age administrative function. Wanax evolution validated through palatial archaeology and cross-cultural authority correlation.

CM_SCRIBE.cypro_minoan_context: Scribal agent in Cypro-Minoan administrative recording system
scholarly_sources: Younger, John. The Aegean Baked Clay Balls (2013)
CM_SCRIBE.notes: ENHANCED: Scribal designation with complete tablet production function. Dupure evolution validated through scribal archaeology and Mediterranean correlation.
